title: Raising The Odds For A Special Connection
text:
Let's deal with reality here. What one views as a liability, another may view as an asset. The primary reasons we are alone aren't due to things out of our control, but the choices we make. Do we view ourselves as others see us or as we feel we should be? Do we expect others to be attracted to something they don't find attractive or expect them to conform to our mold? Do we attempt to mold ourselves into what others seek? In other words, do we start out choosing a person who is compatible, or do we expect the relationship to become compatible? Do we choose a partner based on what we believe we can get from the relationship or what we believe we can bring to the relationship? I've decided to list some things women believe make them less desirable as a partner and then list those things others have stated as having made me less desirable as a partner. Realize that these things are rarely universally positive or negative to all. If we choose a partner who appreciates our qualities, we'll be seen as positive; if we choose a partner who is uncomfortable with our qualities, we'll be seen as negative. It's not about changing ourselves or others, but choosing compatible partners.

Some of the qualities women believe make them less desirable to men (which I don't view as limiting factors):
Age; height; past experiences; physical challenges; non-contagious medical conditions (even terminal ones); introversion; feeling safer and more fulfilled with plants, animals or machines than people; small breasts; hair issues (long, short, curly, straight, etc.); quiet; homebody; shy; super intelligent or limited formal education; assertion and open communication; plain looks or what is labeled as unattractive; inexperienced; inner strength; mathematically inclined 
Some of the qualities women believe make them less desirable to men (which I also view as limiting factors):
Perfectionist; extremist; feeling entitled to be provided or push their agenda onto others; self-centeredness (insensitive, disrespectful, inconsiderate, tactless, etc.); overweight; aggressive; over-reactive; defensive; deceptively withholding what's known to be important; lashing out rather than seeking clarification; speaking or acting before thinking; irresponsible; materialistic; living beyond their means; vague/evasive communication or talking at others; superiority; loud; argumentative; negative/pessimistic; no interest in physical intimacy; power-hungry; fame and fortune hunter; chemical escape patterns; controlling; manipulative; demanding; critical; jealous; dependent; sarcastic
You'll notice most of the qualities I'm not attracted to are those within a person's control, while I am rarely turned off by things out of a person's control (i.e. genetics).
Some of the qualities making me less desirable to women:
Middle-aged; modest income; living a simple farm life in the country; multiple college degrees; prioritizing open/honest communication, health & fitness and nature & agriculture; drive a truck rather than a car; knee issue that prevents jarring activities like running, jumping or dancing; held off completing finish work on my home (wanting to design and build it with a partner) so limited storage increases the clutter; functional introvert who prefers one-on-one or small groups to social settings; prefers subtleties to extremes; prefers maintaining and fixing things rather than replacing with the latest ultimate possession; focuses on the journey rather than the end goal; affectionate; allergic to cats; agnostic (raised Jewish)

I don't expect anyone to change for me, and I don't plan on changing in any of the areas that are important to me (I am very flexible in all other areas), but it would be nice to connect with someone who can appreciate me as I am, as I'll appreciate her as she is. Ideally, I'd love something long-term, but I am also open to short-term. Maybe you are too busy to maintain your vision of an ideal relationship or are here temporarily. I believe in making the most of what is available rather than focusing on what could or should be. You don't need to announce me to the world, but I'm not interested in being hidden, either. If you are open to a limited relationship, just let me know the guidelines and I will respect them. I am open to a friendship or whatever depth we decide works for us. I have chosen to no longer settle just to be in a relationship. Whatever type of relationship you and I choose to develop, we will both see value in and appreciate the other as that person already is, or we will continue our search elsewhere. We seek no more than can be expected of us. Let us create what works best for us... together. Emails without substance will be ignored.

title: Do you miss having a special friend?
text:
Do you miss having a special friend. . . sharing respectful communication and sensuality? Wouldn't it be nice to find someone who cares as much about your feelings as you do his? I love communication. . . not mindless chatter. I love sharing with someone who also enjoys sharing (this is equal sharing, not one being the giver and the other the taker). I'm not interested in the majority of women out there who just seek a provider. It seems all they want is travel, shopping and fine dining; someone to provide them with a life they feel entitled to yet can't afford to provide themselves. There are also ones who seem to want to make up for lost time, focusing on extremes and endless activity, as if to prove something. 

If we're alone, there is probably a reason for that. Mine is I choose to live a simple life on a farm, which isn't seen as attractive by most women. You may be too busy for a relationship, are here for a limited time, have what others may consider physical flaws or even a non-contagious terminal disease. I don't need forever. I'd rather have short-term quality than long-term toleration, though long-term quality isn't something I'd be averse to. My list of qualifications for this special friend is very short [respectful, tranquil, easygoing, communicative yet not talkative, slender (BMI of 20 or less), no contagious diseases and prefer subtleties to extremes]. I don't need you to announce me to the world, but I don't want to be your hidden secret, either. I've shared my preferences as much for you as for me, for I know these qualities tend to energize me and motivate me to be the best partner I can be. You deserve someone who desires and appreciates you, not someone who focuses on satisfying his own needs and/or tolerates you. Some other qualities may be nice, but most won't add significantly to my motivation or investment in what we choose to develop together. Chronological age is irrelevant to me, as long as you aren't immature or just want to talk about illness, death or grandkids.

I understand you have preferences, also, and I respect that. I'll list a little about myself, in case these may be issues for you. I am a divorced, well-educated professional, 6', 155#, with brown hair (lightly sprinkled with grey) and hazel eyes (with glasses). Having no cartilage in one knee limits jarring activities (i.e. jogging or dancing), yet I still get around unassisted, maintain my farm and love hiking in the forest. I am a functional introvert. I'm fine one-on-one or in small groups, but am only comfortable in larger groups when I have a specific purpose for being there (i.e. teaching a class). I have no interest in sports or religion (though I do enjoy philosophical discussions). I maintain a healthy balance of responsibility and playfulness, along with being realistically optimistic. I focus on opportunities, not obstacles. I am respectful and accepting of differences in others, feeling no need to push my agenda onto others or expecting them to conform to my beliefs. I prioritize health and fitness without taking anything to extreme. I'm not a foodie. I love veggies, though prefer tasting the food rather than the spices people tend to drown the food in. I am very attentive and sensual, preferring long drawn-out encounters to rushed performances (it's about the journey, not the destination). I love learning, along with sharing acquired knowledge with those who seek it from me. My career has focused on helping others rather than acquiring wealth. I am very allergic to cats.

To make this convenient for both of us, it is probably best if you live in the vicinity of the San Fernando, Santa Clarita or Antelope Valleys. If what I've written is of interest to you, or it describes someone you know, please reach out. Disrespectful or one-line responses and spam will just be sent to my spam filter.

title: The Face Of Love

title: Do Guys Still Date?
text:
Single life just isn't for me, but really have learned over the last few years what I'm looking for, and really not looking to get into a relationship just for the sake of being in a relationship. 

I'm a normal guy here, I get along with my mom, have a great job, a condo, a car, and admittedly, I hate clutter. I'm the kind of guy who would buy flowers for no reason, kissing you because you are there, or cuddling up under the covers while watching a good movie.

I truly believe in monogamy in all its aspects, i.e. shouldn't have a profile on a dating site if you're committed to and in love with someone.

Lookwise, I think I'm a pretty nice looking man...but beauty is in the eye of the beholder right? I do not have a gym body nor do I suspect I ever will...lol..but I am height/weight proportionate. I'm white, 5ft 11in, 182lbs, negative and definitely not a shallow guy but there has to be some sort of chemistry and attraction. I've learned a lot along the way... under 50 and over 30 works best for me, latin, or ethnic, and a bottom.

Believe me, I'm not perfect and I'm not expecting perfection. Everyone has some sort of baggage, and thinking otherwise is really not being honest or realistic with yourself. 

I primarily live in Palm Springs, but my work takes me throughout Southern California. Multiple residences will probably be in my future.

I like nice dinners, whether it's a romantic sit down dinner or have BBQ, I'm all over the place..lol. I also like movies, occasional baseball game, long drives, slow walks, soft kisses with gentle but all knowing embraces.

There's nothing like holding hands with your special someone while driving, occasionally glancing over only to see him glancing over at you, all the while knowing you both are thinking the same thing..."I love this man." 

Really, at any event, I could care less how good the spectacle is, as long as I'm with you.

title: Friends?
text:
Hi, thanks for reading. This is totally my husband's idea, so please understand that this is a bit different and scary for me. I'm trying my best though. A little about us: We're a normal, married couple trying something that's pretty crazy for us. I'm 41, he's 47. Married 17 years. Please read the whole ad. If interested, please reply and tell a little about yourself. Age, location, occupation, marital status, and what you're looking for. I'd like to know who's responding. 

I posted the ad because my husband was hoping that we could find a few guys, who are interested in a real, platonic, friendship with us. Just platonic friends who can go out and do normal, fun, things together. Dinners, just hanging out, etc. My husband wants me to meet several guys, but hopefully for me to see a few guys repeatedly and establish some friendships. After we get to know the guys, we'd set up a day to meet at our house. Just a nice, normal way to get to know some of the guys that answered the ad, and for them to get to know us better. Just talking and hanging out, so we can get to know them and for them to get to know us. 

One of the scary things is that my husband wants me to be dressed in a bikini the whole time. After we get to know the guys, and everyone is comfortable, my husband and I will go to our garage. Then my husband will come back to the living room and talk to the guys and explain the plan. I'll be in the garage tied into into a metal frame and waiting. Then the guys will be allowed to go to come back to he garage, also. I'll be bent over in the frame, so my butt will be accessible. I'll be tied in, so that I can't move. VERY scary! Our new friends will be able to untie my bikini and pull it off. At that point, they'll be able to touch me and have anal sex with me. Only anal, so I'm pretty worried about it. EXTREMELY worried. 

This is 100% for the guys' enjoyment, not mine. I'll basically be putting myself out there for the guys' enjoyment. So, I'm sort of using the "taking one for the team" attitude. I've been giving this a lot of thought, but I'm still really worried about it, especially, since we're looking to meet new people. So far, A LOT of guys seem interested, which is kind of weird and scary. Definitely overwhelming. So I think we'll be able to find someone we can meet. 

Like I said, I'm pretty nervous, but I'm going along with it. The platonic thing is so the guys and I can get to know each other a little before anything happens. I'll feel more comfortable knowing them a little. Hopefully whoever we meet will also. Also, I recently had a baby, so I'm a bit self conscious about my body, but I'm working on it at the gym! I hope you understand. I'm really working on it, though. I know this whole thing probably sounds crazy to you, but if you have any questions, please ask.

Thanks for reading!
